guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • 5 Watt Solar Panel Operating voltage 12-17 volts
  • Solar Charge Controller
  • LED - 22 Watts
  • LED Controller
  • Direct burial wire
  • 12 Volt Battery Packs
Tools
  • Small Flathead Screwdriver
  • Wire stripper/crimper
  • Wire strippers

parts.text: 5 Watt Solar Panel Operating voltage 12-17 volts

lines.text: The solar panels don’t come with the right connection to your charge controller, so you'll have to make your own connections.  First strip the wires about half an inch.
lines.text_raw: The solar panels don’t come with the right connection to your charge controller, so you'll have to make your own connections.  First strip the wires about half an inch.

lines.text: Put the contact into the crimper and squeeze.
lines.text_raw: Put the contact into the crimper and squeeze.

lines.text: Then insert the contact into the connector to make your first “whip”.  Repeat with the second wire.
lines.text_raw: Then insert the contact into the connector to make your first “whip”.  Repeat with the second wire.

lines.text: Connect the solar panel to the charge controller with your new connectors
lines.text_raw: Connect the solar panel to the charge controller with your new connectors

lines.text: Connect to the charging regulator with your screwdriver
lines.text_raw: Connect to the charging regulator with your screwdriver

lines.text: And connect the LED controller to the LED
lines.text_raw: And connect the LED controller to the LED

lines.text: The 22 W LED we used was surprisingly bright
lines.text_raw: The 22 W LED we used was surprisingly bright

guide.summary: I can’t stand those lame stick-in-the-ground solar light thingies.  If you really need to light a yard/walkway/patio, you’ve got to build your own!
guide.title: Solar LED way brighter than store bought
